Proposed shortening of one sentence in the lead section
text:
This seeks to alter [[#Current consensus]] #35.{{pb}}{{tq|the fact that these falsehoods have been documented - obviously they have been or else we wouldn't be making a reference to it in the Wikipedia bio}} - I'd disagree with that statement. We might be saying that because reliable sources have said that without any documented fact-checking (or at least without anything remotely approaching the scale of what WaPo et al have done). We do that kind of thing all the time. We generally don't require sources to prove the truth of what they say. [[User:Mandruss|Mandruss]][[User talk:Mandruss|]] 01:42, 6 October 2020 (UTC)
::* On the actual proposed rewording, do you support or oppose? It was not clear to me from your comment.

:Minor note..."his campaign" is singular, whereas he has had two campaigns now.  (Though "false and misleading statements" doesn't begin to cover the situation...) Perhaps an opportunity to finally change "The statements have been..." to "The misinformation has been..."
